Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の子
Entry.EnglishText: Girl

Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.JapaneseText: 男の子
Entry.EnglishText: Boy

Entry.JapaneseText: 奥さん
Entry.EnglishText: Missus

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>)
おじいさん
Entry.EnglishText: Old Man

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード港
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd Harbor

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード港・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd Harbor - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの弟に変な事、 吹き込まないでくださいね……
Entry.EnglishText: Don't go putting weird ideas in my brother's head...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律か……
Entry.EnglishText: Right, the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: そっか……戒律のせいで しゃべれないんだったネ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh right... She can't talk to me because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律のせいで、男とは 話せないようだな……
Entry.EnglishText: It seems that she can't talk to men because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律……ですね。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh...the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: そっか、戒律が あったんだったな……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh right, those commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律のせいで、女と 話せないんだったわね……
Entry.EnglishText: He isn't allowed to talk to women because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: いつになったらお家に帰れるの？ 山の上にはトモダチもいるのに、 会えなくてサミシイよぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: When can we go home? I wanna play with my friends up on the mountain again...

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、ヒューマが街を ひとりじめしてるって本当？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, is it true that the Huma are hogging the city for themselves?

Entry.JapaneseText: お兄ちゃんたちは ヒューマなのに、 なんでここにいるの？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, if you guys are Huma, then what are you doing here?

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたら、ヒューマは、 <Blue>蒼獣聖典<White>の勝手な 解釈して……許せないわ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Your blasphemous interpretation of the <Blue>Azure Beast's Scriptures<White> will not go unpunished, Huma!

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律か……それにしても、 なんておっかない目をしてんだ…… なんとかしないとヤバいぜ……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh right, the commandments... Even then, she's glaring at me... We gotta do something about this town...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマがよそ様の台所に 入って来るんじゃない！ メシがまずくなるわ！
Entry.EnglishText: You Gajuma need to learn to stay out of other people's kitchens! You're going to ruin my food!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Blue>幻の島<White>なあ…… 世界各地にそんな話は転がっとる。 ここバビログラードにも そんな話はある。
Entry.EnglishText: The <Blue>Island of Illusions,<White> huh... There are stories like that from all over the world, including here in Babilograd.

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当の事を知っとるのは 昔の海賊くらいのもんだな。
Entry.EnglishText: But I'd say the only people who would know the truth about it would be pirates.

Entry.JapaneseText: もっともそんな連中は もっちろん、 とうにおっ死んじまっとるがの。
Entry.EnglishText: Though anyone who would have known is probably long gone by now.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマがよそ様の台所に 入って来るんじゃない！ メシがまずくなるわ！
Entry.EnglishText: You Gajuma need to learn to stay out of other people's kitchens! You're going to ruin my food!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマはすばらしい。 何がすばらしいかって？ ガジュマじゃない事だよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Huma are wonderful. What do I mean by wonderful? Why, they're not Gajuma, of course.

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、やっぱり家が 落ち着くわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Ah, home sweet home...

Entry.JapaneseText: 慣れん事をする もんじゃないねえ……
どうにも世の中が落ち着かん…… 毎日蒼獣様にお祈りに行って おるんだが……なかなか……
Entry.EnglishText: It seems like society at large just won't settle down. I go every day to pray to the Azure Beast, but nothing has come of my prayers yet...

Entry.JapaneseText: 蒼獣様はおでかけでも されとるのかね……
Entry.EnglishText: Perhaps the Azure Beast is gone for the moment?

Entry.JapaneseText: この地鳴り……蒼獣様が お怒りだと言う者もおる。
Entry.EnglishText: There are people saying that this earthquake is the rage of the Azure Beast...

Entry.JapaneseText: 怒りを鎮めていただくために 海の幸たっぷりのスープを 捧げようかと準備しとるんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: In order to appease the Azure Beast, I've prepared a grand soup from the ocean's harvest as an offering...

Entry.JapaneseText: もはや何が起きてもおかしくない。 蒼獣様への奉げ物はやめて、 非常食を作っておるんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Anything could happen now. I've ceased my offerings to the Azure Beast so I can save food for emergencies.

Entry.JapaneseText: 港はヨソ者で ずいぶんにぎわっておる。 戒律が乱れんか心配だよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Our harbor has been so crowded with outsiders lately... I fear the commandments will be broken!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あんたらもヨソ者か……
Entry.EnglishText: ...You lot are outsiders too, huh...?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『深底ナベ・料理中』 バビログラード港の朝市で買った 新鮮な魚介類がたっぷり入っている。 おいしそうな香りにお腹も鳴りそう。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0> - Ocean Depths Stew - A stew made with an abundance of fresh fish purchased from Babilograd Harbor's morning fish market. Its delicious aroma makes your stomach growl.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『青い春』 何が描いてあるのかよくわからない絵。 著名な画家の作品と思いきや、ここの 主人が趣味で描いたものらしい。 絵のタイトルもビミョウな一品。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Blue Spring - It's not clear what this painting depicts. You would think it's from a famous artist, but it seems that the homeowner himself painted it in his spare time. It's hard to tell how the title relates to the work.
